Civilization and its discontents, S.E

title: The future of an illusion, S.E
His critique of religious belief as illusion. Moses and monotheism, S.E
His argument that Moses was in fact an Egyptian, killed by the Jews in a repetition of the primal crime. That monotheism arises out of guilt for that crime
The present age

title: The nature of the therapeutic action in psychoanalysis

Freud occasionally uses the term ego ideal to designate a model or paradigm to which a person attempts to conform. It is formed via narcissistic identification by the parents. Freud does not develop his theory of the ego ideal in any detail. But it seems to function as that part of the superego that holds out an ideal for a person to aspire to fulfill as an egoidentification. See, for example, Freud, ‘On narcissism: an introduction
Group psychology and the analysis of the ego, S.E. XVIII: 116, 129; The ego and the id, S.E

The suggestion here is that in the analysis – via a series of narcissistic identifications with the analyst – the analysand is able to exchange what had been a punishing superego for a benign ego ideal. That is, this benign ideal would now play a central role in the analysand’s superego functioning
‘Developmental lag’ in the evolution of technique’ in The ego and analysis of defense
